incidents.name: Logpush Availability Issues

incident_updates.body: Upon investigating, engineering determined there was no customer impact. Alert was triggered by false alarm. There was no impact on log delivery.

Cloudflare is observing issues with the Cloudflare Logpush service that may impact some users. Customers may see a drop in logs being delivered.

We are currently investigating the issue. More updates to follow shortly.

components.name: Logs
components.description: Cloudflare's Enterprise Log pull and Log push service

incidents.name: Cloudflare WARP control plane API returning 500 HTTP Status

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Update - DEX results, Posture updates , managing WARP Clients via Dashboard and registering new devices may fail. Team is still investigating this issue.
Customers attempting to manage the Cloudflare One agent through Cloudflare's API or the Cloudflare dashboard may receive HTTP 500 status responses. Connectivity is not impacted. We are investigating.

We are working to mitigate this problem.  More updates to follow shortly.

incidents.name: Cloudflare Auto Minify issues

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The problem has been resolved and we are monitoring current status.

Cloudflare is aware of, and investigating an issue with HTML tag attributes being converted to lower case when using Auto Minify.
Further detail will be provided as more information becomes available.

This issue only impacts the Analytics for the DNS operations. DNS queries and name resolution, as well as updates to DNS records, are not impacted.

incidents.name: Issues linking GitHub accounts to Cloudflare Pages

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

If you unsuccessfully attempted to add a GitHub account during the timeframe of this incident please uninstall GitHub on GitHub.com and reinstall through the Cloudflare dashboard by clicking "Add account" upon project creation.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Cloudflare is aware of and investigating an issue linking GitHub accounts to Cloudflare Pages.

This incident does not affect existing Pages deployments.

This problem has already been mitigated.

incidents.name: User email verification link issues

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Email verification sent to links sent to newly created users are invalid. The user must request a second email be sent to verify their email address.  This impacts all new users signing up attempting to verify their email address and users updating their email address.

incidents.name: Challenges and Turnstile degraded performance

incident_updates.body: Cloudflare identified that there was degraded performance of Challenges and Turnstile products between 13 July 10:30 UTC and 14 July 08:40 UTC. During this issue, some users may have seen slower challenge completions, or may have been unable to pass challenges.

incidents.name: R2 authentication issues

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Cache Reserve

incident_updates.body: We recently published an R2 software release that introduced authentication issues from SIGv4 clients utilizing S3 compatible APIs. Additional Cloudflare products including Cache Reserve, Cache Purge, Images, and Speed Test were also impacted. This change has been rolled back, and we are now monitoring for additional impact.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Cache Reserve

components.name: Cache Reserve
components.description: Cache Reserve is a large, persistent data store implemented on top of R2. By pushing a single button in the dashboard, your website’s cacheable content will be written to Cache Reserve.

incident_updates.body: Between 09:43 - 09:50 UTC, network performance in South Africa was impacted. The issue has been resolved.

incidents.name: Increased 530 errors in Singapore and Jakarta

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
As a result of the fix, impact has been mitigated.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We are continuing to investigate issues where some customer traffic through our Singapore, Singapore - (SIN) and Jakarta, Indonesia - (CGK) locations may experience DNS resolution failures. 

Some customers with traffic going through this location may experience 530 errors.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
Cloudflare is investigating an increased level of 530 errors in Singapore.

incidents.name: Cloudflare Pages — Build issues for GitLab users

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Cloudflare is aware of and investigating an issue with Cloudflare Pages builds which potentially impacts multiple customers. GitLab users may not be able to push changes to their repos, or pushed changes may fail to or be delayed in propagating to Cloudflare Pages. These changes may not be deployed, or may be delayed. This issue only impacts new changes, existing sites and traffic to those sites are not affected.

incidents.name: Cloudflare Zero Trust: Gateway Issues

incident_updates.body:
During 17:11 - 17:33 UTC, users were not able to modify settings in the Zero Trust Gateway product.

Performance and connectivity through Gateway was not impacted

incidents.name: Cloudflare Brotli Availability Issues

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

A small number of customers using Cloudflare Brotli would have experienced degraded services.

The problem is identified and a fix is being released.

incidents.name: Workers Management Dashboard Errors

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Workers customers attempting to delete or rename their worker via the Dashboard may encounter errors. Worker code can still be updated using the editor, CLI or API.

We have identified the problem and are working on deploying a fix.

components.name: Workers
components.description: Cloudflare's JavaScript and WebAssembly execution service

incidents.name: R2 bucket availability impact in ENAM

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We have identified an issue with accessing metadata ranges related to impacted buckets. We've applied a remediation and are monitoring impact.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

A small number of customer buckets in the Eastern North America (ENAM) region are currently experiencing availability issues. This also impacts a small number of Cache Reserve users. Those users will see higher traffic to origin during impact. We are currently investigating and will update within an hour.

components.name: R2
components.description: High-performance storage for files and objects with zero egress charges

incidents.name: Network Performance Issues in IAD

incident_updates.body: Cloudflare is investigating issues with network performance in IAD (Ashburn, VA) which took place between 20:15 UTC and 20:44 UTC. This would have caused Elevated RTT and TTFB for traffic destined for this POP

incidents.name: Custom hostnames activation delays

incident_updates.body: Custom hostnames activations were delayed from 2023-07-05 19:15 UTC to 2023-07-05 22:12 UTC

incidents.name: Cloudflare Dashboard and Cloudflare Workers/Pages API service issues

incident_updates.body:
Between 16:05 UTC to 16:26 UTC, Cloudflare had issues with Cloudflare Dashboard and related Workers/Pages APIs.

These issues did not affect the execution of already deployed assets, the serving of cached files via the Cloudflare CDN or other security features at the Cloudflare Edge.

Customers using the Dashboard or Workers/Pages were impacted as requests might have failed and/or errors may have displayed.
